metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2503 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: Server: Connection Handling). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.42 and prior, 5.7.24 and prior and 8.0.13 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with access to the physical communication segment attached to the hardware where the MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all MySQL Server accessible data and unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 6.4 (Confidentiality and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> there is no way to update mysql-5.5 through upstream marking it deferred 2019-10-03

criterions.comment: mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.63-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
